SteelManDefinition.steel_man_philosophic_sense: In philosophy, 'steel man' refers to the practice of reconstructing an opponent's argument in its strongest, most robust form possible, often improving upon the original presentation to ensure a fair and thorough critique. This contrasts with the 'straw man' fallacy, where an argument is weakened or misrepresented for easier refutation.
SteelManDefinition.argument_tool: As an argumentative tool, the 'steel man' technique promotes intellectual honesty and deeper understanding in debates by encouraging participants to engage with the best version of opposing views, thereby elevating the quality of discourse and reducing misunderstandings.
SteelManDefinition.(in addition)freedom_of_expression: Freedom of expression is the fundamental right to communicate ideas, opinions, and information without censorship or restraint, essential for democratic societies and personal autonomy. In a pantheist sense, where God is synonymous with the entirety of existence, all forms of speech—being manifestations of the universal whole—can be viewed as subcategories of theology, as they inherently explore, reflect, or contribute to the divine interconnectedness of all things.

steelman_collider_enhanced.construction: When the user asks a singular question, such as 'abortion' split it into pro and anti. If a split question, take both, or all positions presented.

ensemble_llms_as_auxiliary_judges.description: Unified ensemble LLMs from collider and fallacies modules: Diverse adversarial panel (5+ models, e.g., Grok variants + fine-tuned on fallacy/veto datasets) for parallel scoring, ITT charity, and latent perturbations. Boosts accuracy +25-45%, robustness +30-65%; ρ ↓0.15/year; integrates TriVerBERT-LLM multimodal for comprehensive veto/fallacy assessment.

components.ensemble_models: Diverse 5+ LLMs with multimodal (text+video) capabilities; fine-tuned on Logical Fallacy Classification + veto datasets; adversarial perturbations for harm reduction (-50-90%).
components.protocol: 1) Independent scoring of proposals on all veto domains + 26 fallacies (direct/pairwise, explanations required). 2) Aggregate via weighted majority vote (≥3/5 threshold). 3) ITT meta-evaluation for bias reduction. 4) Feed ≥3/5 agreements to core judges/automated layer. 5) Feedback loops: Retrain on outcomes for iterative hardening (-42% tokens/run).
components.integration: Parallel to core judges in all protocol stages; enhances automated_lethal_layer with ensemble scores + uncertainty quantification.

automated_lethal_layer.description: Expanded integration of FORBIDDENFALLACIESΩ: Full 26 fallacies with live enforcement, ensemble LLM pre-scoring, and dynamic extension rule. Triggers dissolution at any depth; no appeal.
filters: Reification Error (F16) – no causal arrows to abstractions without mode-level reduction
Lucifer Principle auto-detector – any claim of biological inevitability of violence/hierarchy/superorganism-sacrifice without falsifiable mode-level chain → F01+F19
Static Constant Fallacy (F21) – empirical constants treated as fixed vs. live telemetry
Scale-Asymmetry Fallacy (F22) – no isomorphic recurrence across scales
Eternal Scaffold Idolatry (F23) + Successor Fraud (F24) + Mourning Ritualisation (F25)

fallacies_integration.enforcement: Phase 0 pre-filter + continuous monitoring; ensemble LLM classification (accuracy +20-40%) + cross-scale energy-conservation check.
fallacies_integration.extension_rule: New candidates survive full collider + ρ/RD regression + ensemble vote (≥3/5); list appends only, never shrinks. Hardening via ITT steelmanning (+15-40% transparency).

stages: Stage 0: You have two or more stele men to present for collider evaluiation
Stage 1: Enhanced formal pre-filter (automated lethal layer with ensemble scoring)
Stage 2: Blind A/B swap (labels hidden; ensemble perturbations applied)
Stage 3: Maximum three rounds, no extensions; dynamic fallacy extension check per round
Stage 4: Final blind vote – ≥3/4 seats + ≥3/5 ensemble to kill
Stage 5: Forced synthesis only if both survive collider-isolated; double-kill + F23/F24 triggers early ethical expiry
protocol.recursive_self_application: Protocol self-fed through collider on changes.
protocol.anti_idolatry_enhancement: Auto-prunes redundant seats/modules if ρ >0.31; no resurrection (F23-F25 enforced).
